meanings.definition: Spoil the surface or appearance of (something), especially with writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: Please do not deface the school property with graffiti.
meanings.sent2: The vandals defaced the historic monument with spray paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to deface the family photo with crayons.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature seemed to deface the beauty of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The rainstorm threatened to deface the freshly painted fence.

meanings.definition: Damage the surface or appearance of (something) by scratching or marking it.
meanings.sent1: The careless cat accidentally defaced the leather couch with its claws.
meanings.sent2: The hooligans defaced the bus stop by carving their initials into it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to want to deface the tree trunk with its sharp teeth.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bore scars where time had seemed to deface its bark.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins showed signs of erosion that threatened to deface their beauty.
